intro: Dissochaeta conica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access groundwater. Dissochaeta conica is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is an important component of local plant communities.
